info.description: Backend API for OpenHack handling participant accounts, teams, feature flags, and superuser check-in tooling.
info.title: OpenHack Backend API

post.description: Confirms if an initialized account already set a password so the UI can branch between login and signup.
Validates submitted credentials against the stored hash and returns a refreshed token plus account snapshot.
Accepts credentials for an initialized participant and issues a signed session token upon success.

get.description: Provides the participant's active stage and boolean flags to drive feature toggles in the client.

patch.description: Stores new first and last names and returns a refreshed token so clients keep their session in sync.

get.description: Responds with PONG so callers can verify the accounts service group is reachable.
Reads the bearer token context and echoes the hydrated participant document.
Returns the 3 finalist teams (middle, right, left order)
Returns whether voting is open, if user has voted, and the list of finalists

post.description: Records a vote for one of the finalists
Records a judgment where a judge compares two teams and selects a winner.
Returns the next team ID for the judge to evaluate. Applies offset on first call, then cycles through teams until judging is complete.

get.description: Returns detailed information about a team including submission data.

post.description: Validates the 2-minute connect token and mints a new 24-hour token for judge platform access.
post.summary: Upgrade connect token to full session token

get.description: Lightweight heartbeat used by load balancers to confirm the OpenHack API is alive.
Exposes the semantic version bundled with the running process for smoke tests.

post.description: Validates privileged credentials and returns a token plus superuser profile.

get.description: Hashes each account into deterministic piles so on-site staff can stage badge pickup.
get.summary: Retrieve badge pile assignments for all accounts

get.description: Reads the cached flag document so console operators can inspect rollout state.

put.description: Applies a map of flag values and echoes the resulting assignments.

post.description: Updates one flag value and returns the refreshed flag map for verification.

delete.description: Deletes a flag from the assignments and returns the remaining map.

post.description: Sets every tracked flag back to false and returns the cleared map.
post.summary: Reset all feature flags to false

get.description: Ensures the caller holds both the required role and feature toggles before allowing access.
get.summary: Validate that the current JWT satisfies flag middleware

get.description: Lists named flag stage presets so admins can preview rollout scripts.

post.description: Saves a stage blueprint listing which flags to enable or disable.

delete.description: Deletes an unused flag stage and returns the removed record.

post.description: Fetches the stage, applies its instructions, and returns the resulting flags payload.
Creates a short-lived 2-minute token that is displayed via QR code for judges to scan and exchange for a full session token.
Uses the Crowd Bradley-Terry algorithm to compute team rankings and judge reliability scores from all judgments in the database.
Groups judges by pair attribute and creates Latin rectangle assignment
post.summary: Initialize judging configuration with judge pairing

post.description: Creates a new judge with the given ID and name.

get.description: Confirms the privileged routes segment is reachable by returning a simple PONG.
Echoes the active superuser payload so operators can verify their scopes.

post.description: Creates a passwordless account record so the participant can complete onboarding later.
post.summary: Initialize an account shell for a participant

get.description: Looks up the account by ID and returns the account.
get.summary: Gets an account based on the accountID

put.description: Updates the consumables for an account and emits an event for telemetry.

patch.description: Creates a present in event, and changes the property of an account to present.
Creates a present out event, and changes the property of an account to not present.
patch.summary: flags a participant as not present

post.description: Looks up the account by ID, emits telemetry, and returns the account plus computed badge pile. This route also modifies the account to be checked-in.

get.description: Pulls tag details from cache or Mongo and then fetches the linked account.

post.description: Persists the assignment and emits an event for check-in telemetry.
post.summary: Assign a tag to an account

get.description: Looks up the caller's team by membership and returns submission metadata and members.
get.summary: Fetch the team for the authenticated account

post.description: Seeds a new team with the caller as captain and returns a refreshed token.
post.summary: Create a new team led by the authenticated account

delete.description: Removes the final member from the roster and drops the team document when safe.

get.description: Reads the cached roster for the caller's team to power team management UIs.
get.summary: List team members for the authenticated account

patch.description: Validates capacity, attaches the caller, and returns a refreshed token plus updated roster.
patch.summary: Join an existing team by ID

patch.description: Allows captains to prune roster members and returns the updated list for confirmation.
patch.summary: Remove a teammate by account ID

patch.description: Detaches the caller from the roster and returns the remaining membership plus refreshed token.

get.description: Returns a PONG from the teams group so orchestration checks can verify connectivity.
Retrieves basic team information including name, members, submission details, and table assignment for a given team ID. Useful for participants reviewing team details before joining via a join link.

patch.description: Applies a new team name and broadcasts the change to the event stream.
patch.summary: Change the name of the current team

get.description: Retrieves the current submission details including name, description, repo, and presentation links.

patch.description: Persists revised blurb content so reviewers receive the latest write-up.
Records a new project name and emits an event so judges see the latest label.
Keeps the presentation URL in sync for the demo day kiosk.
Stores a repository URL so judges can inspect source material from the dashboard.
Applies a new team table and broadcasts the change to the event stream.

message.example: account does not belong to a team
account not initialized - talk to the administrator
this feature is not available right now

desc.example: A brief description of my project
A brief description of my project

AccountAuth.description: Provide the participant bearer token as `Bearer <token>`.
AccountAuth.name: Authorization

SuperUserAuth.description: Provide the superuser bearer token as `Bearer <token>`.
SuperUserAuth.name: Authorization

tags.description: Participant account lifecycle tooling for superusers.
tags.name: Superusers Participants

tags.description: Staff passport scanning and presence tooling endpoints.
tags.name: Superusers Staff

tags.description: Badge assignment and pile lookup endpoints.
tags.name: Superusers Badges

tags.description: Judge token generation and judging initialization endpoints.
tags.name: Superusers Judging

tags.description: Judge token upgrade and authentication flows.
tags.name: Judges Auth

tags.description: Judge team assignment and judging endpoints.
tags.name: Judges Core

tags.description: Meta routes like ping and whoami
tags.name: Accounts Meta

tags.description: Registration and login flows for participants.
tags.name: Accounts Auth

tags.description: Health probes for team services and other meta routes.
tags.name: Teams Meta
